item.name: Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee
Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

cdata.text:
Strategy for Public Health Preparedness and Response to Artificial Intelligence Threats

This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to develop a strategy for public health preparedness, response, and biodefense that addresses the risks to national health security posed by the misuse of artificial intelligence, such as biological weapons and viruses and bacteria that are resistant to treatment.

bill.title: Strategy for Public Health Preparedness and Response to Artificial Intelligence Threats

item.title: Strategy for Public Health Preparedness and Response to Artificial Intelligence Threats
Strategy for Public Health Preparedness and Response to Artificial Intelligence Threats
A bill to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop a strategy for public health preparedness and response to artificial intelligence threats, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
